title: 835 persons vaccinated against COVID-19
body_lines: COVID-19 vaccines were administered to 835 persons on Monday and a total of 17,019,170 persons have received at least one COVID-19 vaccine to date.
According to the Epidemiology Unit, 14,436,626 persons have received the second dose of the COVID-19 vaccine and 7,909,478 persons have received the third vaccine dose.
On Monday, 503 persons received the booster dose. The Pfizer COVID-19 vaccine is being administered as the third dose in the country.

The first dose of Pfizer has been administered to 2,527,111 persons, which includes 110 persons vaccinated on Monday. The second dose of the vaccine was administered to 210 persons on Monday, with a total of 897,395 persons have received the second dose of Pfizer to date. A total of 12,048,517 persons have received the first dose of Sinopharm and the second dose has been administered to 11,177,465 persons. On Monday, two persons received the first dose of Sinopharm, and 10 persons received the second dose of the vaccine.
The first dose of AstraZeneca has been administered to 1,479,631 persons and the second dose has been administered to 1,418,593.
The Epidemiology Unit states that 804,801 persons have received the first dose of Moderna, and 787,361 persons have received the second dose of the vaccine.
According to the Epidemiology Unit, the first dose of Sputnik V has been administered to 159,110 persons and the second dose has been administered to 155,812 persons.
